author: Drew FitzGerald
title: T-Mobile Joins 5G Race With Early Service Set for New York, Los Angeles
text:
BARCELONAâ€”Top U.S. carriers are taking differing paths, both geographically and technically, as they plot out upgrades to their wireless networks in the country.
T-Mobile US Inc. said it plans to launch fifth-generation, or 5G, service across 30 cities in the fourth quarter, hitting parts of New York, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and Dallas first.

The... RELATED VIDEO The Modern Cell Carrier: How We Got Here The U.S. wireless industry is dominated by four major players: Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile and Sprint. Now that just about everyone has a cellphone, each operator is looking for new ways to grow. But how did we go from the days of one giant landline monopoly to four competitive cell companies?
